e="preserve">[http://www.bigpoint.net Bigpoint GmbH] is a game developer based in Hamburg, Germany which produces browser based MMORPG games that are unique in that do not require any downloads to play.
Founded by [http://www.linkedin.com/in/heikohubertz Heiko Hubertz] in December of 2002, Bigpoint has experienced record growth (more than 4500% in 5 years) since its creation and won numerous business awards including the [http://www.redherring.com Red Herring Award] in 2007 - placing it among the top 100 most innovative businesses - and the Ruban d'Honneur at the [http://www.businessawardseurope.com European Business Awards] in 2009.
In June of 2008 a 70% controlling share of [http://www.bigpoint.net Bigpoint GmbH] was purchased by NBCU's and GE's joint venture [http://www.gelending.com/servlets/ActionServlet?action=ShowPeacockHomePage Peacock Equity Fund] and UK PE Firm [http://www.gmtpartners.com/ GMT Communications Partners] in a $110m (€70m) deal that gave each a 35% share of the company.
This allowed the three initial venture capital investors - [http://www.aurelia-pe.de/ Aurelia Private Equity], [http://www.europeanfounders.com/ European Founders Fund] and [http://www.unitedinternet.de United Internet Beteiligungen] - to sell out while CEO [http://www.linkedin.com/in/heikohubertz Heiko Hubertz] re-invested his share of the sale to retain a 30% stake in the company.
[http://www.linkedin.com/in/heikohubertz Heiko Hubertz] currently acts as the company's Managing Director.
Bigpoint has a portfolio of more than 40 games translated into 20 languages, with the two largest being [http://www.seafight.com SeaFight] with approximately 15.7 million registered users and [http://www.darkorbit.com Dark Orbit] with approximately 14.2 million registered users.
The company claims to receive more than 200,000 new user registrations each day.
A complete list of Bigpoint's games can be found [http://www.bigpoint.net/index.es?action=products&subpage=products_games&lang=en Here]
